properties.name: Advice
properties.location: between the townships of Irrewillipe, Kawarren, Lovat, Wimba, Charleys Creek, Carlisle River and covers the township of Gellibrand
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for between the townships of Irrewillipe, Kawarren, Lovat, Wimba, Charleys Creek, Carlisle River and covers the township of Gellibrand.
  • This bushfire is currently contained.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice - Stay Informed issued at 4:25 pm 07/02/2026.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • Heavy machinery and aircraft continue to operate in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
Road closures:
  • Gellibrand - Carlisle Road in both directions between Brown Dog Track and Tuckers Orchard Road.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • All Forest and National Park Tracks and Roads within the impacted area are closed.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 10/02/2026 04:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Castleburn, Cobbannah, Dargo. 
  • There is a bushfire at Caslteburn-Mount-Budgee-Budgee that is under control.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This Community Information replaces the advisory issued on 8 Sunday. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bullengarook, Greendale, Lerderderg.
  • There is a bushfire at Greendale that is under control. 
  • Firefighters with machinery will continue to work on the fire and the surrounding areas.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice message issued at 12:50 pm Sunday 8th February.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • All roads in the Lerderberg State Park are closed including: Obriens Road between Greendale-Trentham Rd and Bluegum Track.
  • The Lerderderg State Park is closed to all visitors including campers, runners and walkers.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management.

The next update is expected by 12/02/2026 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: between the townships of Kennedys Creek and Carlisle River
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for between the townships of Kennedys Creek and Carlisle River. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice Message issued on 7 February 2026.
  • There is a bushfire at Carlisle River that is under control.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Firefighters remain on site to continue to extinguish any remaining hotspots.
  • Crews asssited by heavy machinery are  working on rehabilitating affected tracks and stabilising key areas of the fire ground.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Castleburn, Crooked River, Dargo, Waterford. 
  • There is a bushfire at Wonnangatta - Dargo Complex that is under control.
  • This Community Information replaces the advisory issued on 6 February.
  • Firefighters are onsite to continue extinguishment of any remaining hotspots, particularly around the extensive perimeter of the fire.
  • Crews assisted by heavy machinery are working on rehabilitating affected tracks and stabilising key areas of the fire ground to protect streams and rivers from sediment.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
  • Motorists need to remain vigilant and be aware of crews, large vehicles and heavy machinery using roads in the area.


This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Bucheen Creek, Cravensville, Lucyvale, Cudgewa and the Nariel Valley and surrounds.
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bucheen Creek, Cravensville, Lucyvale, Cudgewa and the Nariel Valley and surrounds. .
  • This bushfire started 27Km West Of Walwa in Mt Lawson State Park on the 5th January and has spread through to the Wabba Wilderness Park. 
  • The fire is approximately 121,500 hectares and is contained.
  • For the latest Community Recovery Newsletter click HERE
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued on the 5th February, 2026.
  • Heavy rainfall is forecast for Sunday 8th February and Monday 9th February.  
  • For more information about Floods, storms and landslides after fires go to  CLICK HERE
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire
Impacts in your area: 
  • The Murray Valley Highway is open.
  • The Benambra-Corryong Road is open.

  • The following parks within the Parks Victoria estate are currently closed to the public: Mount Lawson State Park, Pheasant Creek Flora Reserve, Mountain Creek Education Area, Granya Bushland Reserve, Beetooma Stream Side Reserve, Berringama Bushland Reserve, Wabba Wilderness Park. 
These closures are in place for public safety. To check for updates before planning your visit Click HERE

  • Emergency services, machinery and aircraft will remain in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.
  • Monitor air quality and take precautions to protect your health by visiting https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/ 
  • For localised mental health support please contact Albury Wodonga Health Mental Health Triage Line on 1300 104 211
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 13/02/2026 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: 27Km West Of Walwa Issue Date: Sunday 08 February 2026, 11:35 am Next Update: Friday 13 February 2026, 12:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41168/moreinfo This Advice message is being issued for Bucheen Creek, Cravensville, Lucyvale, Cudgewa and the Nariel Valley and surrounds. . - This bushfire started 27Km West Of Walwa in Mt Lawson State Park on the 5th January and has spread through to the Wabba Wilderness Park. - The fire is approximately 121,500 hectares and is contained. - For the latest Community Recovery Newsletter click HERE - This Advice replaces the Advice issued on the 5th February, 2026. - Heavy rainfall is forecast for Sunday 8th February and Monday 9th February. - For more information about Floods, storms and landslides after fires go to CLICK HERE There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: the Walwa River Road fire-affected area and nearby communities
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for the Walwa River Road fire-affected area and nearby communities. 
  • The Bureau of Meteorology has advised that severe thunderstorms are possible from Sunday morning into Tuesday afternoon in the North East/ Upper Murray area. Severe thunderstorms may produce heavy rainfall leading to flash flooding.

  • In fire-affected areas, heavy rain may create dangerous conditions for communities, especially when out in the open or driving.
  • Dangers include: ash, debris, rocks, mud, trees and landslides across properties and roads. This may affect travel on the Murray Valley Highway.
  • Trees that have been damaged by heat or fire may be more likely to fall when it's stormy or wet.
  • Avoid walking or working in burnt areas or along riverbanks and gullies during and immediately after rainfall.
  • If your situation is life threatening, call Triple Zero (000).
You should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

Be aware of potential hazards caused by the severe thunderstorms, including hazards such as: floodwater, debris, damaged buildings, trees down, fallen power lines etc.



This message was issued by State Emergency Service. 

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this incident. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - SEVERE WEATHER - Stay Informed
Incident Location: the Walwa River Road fire-affected area and nearby communities
Issue Date: Monday 09 February 2026, 02:21 pm
Next Update: Tuesday 10 February 2026, 06:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41202/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for the Walwa River Road fire-affected area and nearby communities. 
- The Bureau of Meteorology has advised that severe thunderstorms are possible from Sunday morning into Tuesday afternoon in the North East/ Upper Murray area. Severe thunderstorms may produce heavy rainfall leading to flash flooding.


- In fire-affected areas, heavy rain may create dangerous conditions for communities, especially when out in the open or driving.
- Dangers include: ash, debris, rocks, mud, trees and landslides across properties and roads. This may affect travel on the Murray Valley Highway.
- Trees that have been damaged by heat or fire may be more likely to fall when it's stormy or wet.
- Avoid walking or working in burnt areas or along riverbanks and gullies during and immediately after rainfall.
- If your situation is life threatening, call Triple Zero (000).



You should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions. 

Be aware of potential hazards caused by the severe thunderstorms, including hazards such as: floodwater, debris, damaged buildings, trees down, fallen power lines etc.
